meanings.definition: A person who fails a test or course.
meanings.sent1: The teacher offered extra help to the flunkers in the class.
meanings.sent2: The school counselor provided support for the flunkers who needed it.
meanings.sent3: The flunkers decided to form a study group to improve their grades.
meanings.sent4: The group of flunkers felt discouraged but determined to do better next time.
meanings.sent5: The flunkers' faces showed disappointment after receiving their test results.

meanings.definition: To fail a test or course.
meanings.sent1: Some students fear they will flunkers the final exam.
meanings.sent2: If you don't study, you might flunkers the math test.
meanings.sent3: I hope I don't flunkers the history quiz; I studied all night!
meanings.sent4: She was worried she would flunkers the driving test, so she practiced a lot.
meanings.sent5: The thought of flunkers the exam made him study harder than ever before.
